answers.answer: I have neuropathy right foot but this is different. Just the bottom of my feet, on fire, burning.
My legs do hurt but all I can think of is this overwhelming depression. I was never depressed before. You hang in there and I will. Do t let me do this alone.

I wouldn't dare. Went to a meeting. My daughter is 29 & has some severe medical problems. She takes pain meds. Not a ton but about 60 drones a month. She's on on this site today & wants to go with me to a meeting tomorrow. She's so proud of me. How great is that at day 12. Praise The LORD GOD Almighty!!!!!
I am so proud of both of you!  Things can only get better from here! Your one day closer to no longer being a slave to addiction!

You are doing so awesome.  I never had my feet feel like they were burning.  Have you tried soaking them in warm water with the epsom salts?  If that doesn't work and it gets worse I would get it checked out.  Oh another idea...do you have diabetes?  If you do the stress of the WD's might have shook the diabetes up.Sorry hun, those are the only things I can think of.  Take care of yourself...and if you get any more weird symptoms definitely take yourself to urgent care and get checked out....just to be safe.Hugz

Hi, there, a few people who are detoxing tramadol, ive heard them say theie feet are burning like their on fire, so it is normal.Do the dishes?....gee, i didnt do the dishes till i was about 4 months clean : )And i have OCD- a cleaning disorder, i cant stop cleaning. Not in recovery though, i couldnt get out of bed for months !!!Hang in there, congratulations on day 12 !!

Oh Amanda.......thank you SO much for what you said about the cleaning disorder.  I'm not OCD but I'm extremely Type A.  At two months I still look, see and don't do.  The cleaning has taken a back seat which NEVER happens.  I'm so glad to hear that I'm not the only one.  So maybe in about a month my house will be clean again??

I had the same problem when I detoxed off oxy. Try elevating your feet above your heart as your laying down. I noticed my feet were really red also. This will pass with time. Mine did flare back up after 30 days but I think I just walked to much at Disney world. Try some ice packs also. Good luck.

Look....see....dont do...haha..that was me to a tea !!!I tell ya, i never wanted my ocd back so bad during recovery : )I think all us females get so stressed and panicked when we cant clean and it can depress us so quickly.It feels if our house isn't in order, our life isn't in order : )Ejm, i hope your feet are not too bad today, let us know how your feeling : )

Better today. But on day 14 out of no where severe diarrhea.  Waves of recovery waves of sick. I'm just so glad to be one day closer to health & a new life. I swear I'm making my meeting if I have to wear a diaper, lol.

Hi happy two weeks! You're doing great! So at this point, waves of everything will start to come and go. Happy /depressed, energy /weakness, constipation /diarrhea,  etc. I call this the roller coaster stage. You may have a string of good days, then some bad ones.  Its normal. Soon there will be many more good days than bad. Treat the symptoms as they come. One immodium will make you more comfortable. Rest when tired, cry when sad. Talk to folks .Drink lots of water and definitely hit the meeting! Whoo hoo! You're doing it!
Thanks hanging in pray for strength & energy. Lol

question: So the bottom of my feet are burning.  It just started today. Please remind me this is normal. Otherwise I'm starting to feel a little better but I can't hardly walk from the couch to my bathroom. It's crazy. My family thinks I should just be able to will myself to do the dishes. But honestly I just can't get off the couch. I'm so weak.Thank you all so much. Everyone helps me. Those considering stopping. Those right behind me & especially those who went before willing to talk to me & help me.
title: Day 12 new symptom
